00002  * @file hwclock.c
00003  * @date 2007-Dez-11
00004  * @author S. Rohdemann, S. Radtke

00011  *    of the Hardware Timer Function.

00014 #include    "config.h"
00015 #include    <avr/io.h>
00016 #ifndef __OPTIMIZE__
00017 #   define __OPTIMIZE__ 0
00018 #endif
00019 #include    <util/delay.h>
00020 #include    <avr/interrupt.h>
00021 #include    "ntrxtypes.h"
00022 #include    "hwclock.h"

00027 // #define CONFIG_SPI_TRACE 1
00028 #ifdef CONFIG_SPI_TRACE
00029 extern int traceOn;
00030 #endif
00031 
00032 // #define CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL   (1)
00033 
00034 
00035 
00036 #ifdef CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL
00037 #   define TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE       (256 - 32)  /*prescaler 1*/
00038 #else
00039     // #define  MILLISECONDS_PER_TICK   10 /* at 7,3728 MHz prescaler 1024 -> TCNT0 = 256 - 72 for 10ms tick */
00040     // #define TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE       (256 - 72)
00041     // #define TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE       (256 - 200)
00042 #   define TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE       (256 - 230)
00043 #endif /*CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL*/
00044 
00045 
00046 #define MILLISECONDS_PER_TICK   1 /* at 7,3728 MHz prescaler 32 -> TCNT0 = 256 - 230 for 1ms tick */
00047 
00048 
00049 #define STATE_HIGH   5
00050 #define STATE_LOW   -5
00051 #define MAX_DELAY_US ( 768 / ( F_CPU / 1000000UL ))
00052 #define MAX_DELAY_MS ( 262 / ( F_CPU / 1000000UL ))
00053 
00054 volatile bool_t key_flags[] = { FALSE, FALSE, FALSE };
00055 volatile static uint32_t    jiffies = 0;
00056 static  uint32_t    bogo_mips = 0;
00057 static  uint8_t hwclTimerReloadVal = TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE;
00058 
00059 
00060 
00061 /***************************************************************************/
00062 /**
00063  * Deprecated function please dont use for
00064  * new projects
00065  */
00066 void hwdelay( uint32_t t )
00067 {
00068   unsigned long lc = t >> 8;
00069 
00070   if (t == 0) return;
00071 
00072   while(lc--) _delay_loop_2(512);
00073   _delay_loop_2((t & 0xFF)<<1);
00074 }
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078 /***************************************************************************/
00079 /**
00080  * @brief Delay processing for n microseconds.
00081  * @param us this is the delay in microseconds
00082  *
00083  * This function is used for waiting before continue with
00084  * programm execution. Interrupts are still processed.
00085  * Because of the high inaccuracy of the delay function
00086  * this function tries to compensate the delay error
00087  * by adding an offset.
00088  */
00089 void HWDelayus( uint16_t us )
00090 {
00091     uint16_t ti;
00092 
00093 #ifdef CONFIG_SPI_TRACE
00094     if( traceOn == TRUE )
00095     {
00096         printf ("           delay: %d usec\n", us);
00097     }
00098 #endif
00099     if( us == 0 ) return;
00100 
00101     /*
00102      * this is for the loop processing time
00103      * Delays in ms are about 10% longer.
00104      * Delays in us between 100% down to 10%.
00105      * _delay_us seams to be not very accurate.
00106      */
00107     ti = us << 1;
00108     if( us > 90 )
00109     {
00110         ti += (us >> 2);
00111     }
00112 
00113     while( ti > MAX_DELAY_US )
00114     {
00115         _delay_loop_1( MAX_DELAY_US );
00116         ti -= MAX_DELAY_US;
00117     }
00118     if( ti > 0 )
00119     {
00120         _delay_loop_1( ti );
00121     }
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00125 
00126 /***************************************************************************/
00127 /**
00128  * @brief Delay processing for n milliseconds.
00129  * @param ms this is the delay in milliseconds
00130  *
00131  * This function is used for waiting TIMER_RELOAD_VALUEbefore continue with
00132  * programm execution. Interrupts are still processed.
00133  */
00134 void HWDelayms( uint16_t ms )
00135 {
00136 #ifdef CONFIG_SPI_TRACE
00137     if( traceOn == TRUE )
00138     {
00139         printf ("           delay: %d msec\n", ms);
00140     }
00141 #endif /* CONFIG_SPI_TRACE */
00142     if( ms == 0 ) return;
00143 
00144     /*
00145      * this is for the loop processing time
00146      * Delays in ms are about 10% longer.
00147      * Delays in us between 100% down to 10%.
00148      * _delay_us seams to be not very accurate.
00149      */
00150     while( ms > MAX_DELAY_MS )
00151     {
00152         _delay_ms( MAX_DELAY_MS );
00153         ms -= MAX_DELAY_MS;
00154     }
00155 
00156     if( ms > 0 )
00157     {
00158         _delay_ms( ms );
00159     }
00160 }
00161 
00162 
00163 /***************************************************************************/
00164 /**
00165  * @brief clock tick initialization
00166  * @param start this is the start value for jiffies
00167  *
00168  * This function initializes the Timer 0 in the AVR to
00169  * generate an interrupt ever 10 ms.
00170  */
00171 void hwclockRestart (uint32_t start)
00172 {
00173 #   ifdef CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL
00174     ASSR = (1 << AS0);
00175     AVR_TCCR0 = (1 << CS00);                /* Timer0 clk/1  */
00176 #   else
00177     //AVR_TCCR0 = (1 << CS02) | (1 << CS01)| (1 << CS00);  /* Timer0 clk/1024 normal mode int every 0.13888 ms */
00178     AVR_TCCR0 = (1 << CS01)| (1 << CS00);  /* Timer0 clk/32  */
00179 #   endif /*CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL*/
00180     AVR_TIMSK = (1 << TOIE0);
00181     AVR_TCNT0 = hwclTimerReloadVal;
00182 
00183     jiffies = start;
00184     bogo_mips = 0;
00185 }
00186 
00187 
00188 
00189 /***************************************************************************/
00190 /**
00191  * @brief clock tick initialization
00192  *
00193  * This function initializes the Timer 0 in the AVR to
00194  * generate an interrupt ever 10 ms.
00195  */
00196 void hwclock_init(void)
00197 {
00198     /*
00199      * Switches are on Port E
00200      */
00201     SW0_DIR &= ~SW0_PIN;    /* set port to input */
00202     SW1_DIR &= ~SW1_PIN;
00203     SW2_DIR &= ~SW2_PIN;
00204 
00205     SW0_PORT |= SW0_PIN;    /* enable pull-up */
00206     SW1_PORT |= SW1_PIN;    /* enable pull-up */
00207     SW2_PORT |= SW2_PIN;    /* enable pull-up */
00208 
00209     hwclockRestart (0);
00210     sei ();
00211 }
00212 
00213 
00214 
00215 /***************************************************************************/
00216 /**
00217  * @brief return system clock in milliseconds
00218  * @returns time in milliseconds
00219  *
00220  * This function returns the elapsed time since
00221  * program start in milliseconds.
00222  */
00223 uint32_t    hwclock(void)
00224 {
00225     uint32_t    r;
00226 
00227     ENTER_TASK;
00228     r = jiffies;
00229     LEAVE_TASK;
00230     return (r);
00231 }
00232 
00233 
00234 
00235 /***************************************************************************/
00236 /**
00237  * @brief Modifies the time interval between any two subsequent timer ticks.
00238  * @param tuningDirection +1 to speed up the hwclock, -1 to speed down,
00239  * 0 to reset to default.
00240  */
00241 void hwclock_tune(int8_t tuningDirection)
00242 {
00243 #   ifndef CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL
00244     uint8_t reloadVal = hwclTimerReloadVal;
00245 
00246     switch (tuningDirection)
00247     {
00248         case -1:
00249             if (reloadVal > 0) reloadVal--;
00250             break;
00251 
00252         case 0:
00253             reloadVal = TIMER_RELOAD_VALUE;
00254             break;
00255 
00256         case 1:
00257             if (reloadVal < 0xFF) reloadVal++;
00258             break;
00259 
00260         default:
00261             break;
00262     }
00263 
00264     ENTER_TASK;
00265     hwclTimerReloadVal = reloadVal;
00266     LEAVE_TASK;
00267 #   endif /* !CONFIG_HWCLOCK_USE_CRYSTAL */
00268 }
00269 
00270 
00271 
00272 
00273 /***************************************************************************/
00274 uint8_t GetHwclReloadVal(void)
00275 {
00276     return hwclTimerReloadVal;
00277 }
00278 
00279 
00280 
00281 /***************************************************************************/
00282 /**
00283  * @brief Update key state
00284  * @param stat this is the logic level of the key port
00285  * @param id this is the index of the keylist
00286  *
00287  * This function updates the keystate every 10ms.
00288  * The main purpose is to eliminate key bouncing.
00289  */
00290 void KeyUpdate (uint8_t stat, uint8_t id)
00291 {
00292     static int  state[] = { STATE_HIGH, STATE_HIGH, STATE_HIGH};
00293 
00294     if (stat != 0)
00295     {
00296         if(state[id] > STATE_LOW)
00297         {
00298             state[id]--;
00299         }
00300     }
00301     else
00302     {
00303         if(state[id] < STATE_HIGH)
00304         {
00305             state[id]++;
00306         }
00307     }
00308 
00309     if(state[id] == STATE_HIGH)
00310     {
00311         key_flags[id] = TRUE;
00312     }
00313 
00314     if(state[id] == STATE_LOW)
00315     {
00316         key_flags[id] = FALSE;
00317     }
00318 }
00319 
00320 
00321 
00322 /***************************************************************************/
00323 /**
00324  * @brief Timer 0 overflow interrupt
00325  *
00326  * Interrupt service routine for the hardware timer
00327  */
00328 SIGNAL(SIG_OVERFLOW0)
00329 {
00330     AVR_TCNT0 = hwclTimerReloadVal;
00331 
00332     KeyUpdate (SW0_IN, 0);
00333     KeyUpdate (SW1_IN, 1);
00334     KeyUpdate (SW2_IN, 2);
00335 
00336     jiffies += MILLISECONDS_PER_TICK;
00337 }
